bibl.title: Demonology during the Late Ptolemaic and Greco-Roman Periods in Egypt. Avec résumé en anglais. - David Frankfurter, Master-Demons, Local Spirits, and Demonology in the Roman Mediterranean World: An Afterword to Rita Lucarelli.
bibl.note: 1. Ancient Egyptian "demons" versus Greek daimones. - 2. The iconography of demons. - 3. Ancient Egyptian demonology and the representation of "evil". - 4. Seth and the demonization of the foreigners. - 5. The guardian demons in the Graeco-Roman temples and the Book of the Dead. - 6. Gods controlling demons, or demonized gods. - 7. Conclusions.

bibl.title: Journal of Ancient Near Eastern Religions

bibl.seg: Lucarelli Rita, Demonology during the Late Ptolemaic and Greco-Roman Periods in Egypt. Avec résumé en anglais. - David Frankfurter, Master-Demons, Local Spirits, and Demonology in the Roman Mediterranean World: An Afterword to Rita Lucarelli.
Journal of Ancient Near Eastern Religions 11 (2011) pp. 109-125; - 126-131.

1. Ancient Egyptian "demons" versus Greek daimones. - 2. The iconography of demons. - 3. Ancient Egyptian demonology and the representation of "evil". - 4. Seth and the demonization of the foreigners. - 5. The guardian demons in the Graeco-Roman temples and the Book of the Dead. - 6. Gods controlling demons, or demonized gods. - 7. Conclusions.
